meanings.definition: Easily influenced or affected by others.
meanings.sent1: She was so impressionable that she believed everything her friends told her.
meanings.sent2: Children are often impressionable and can easily pick up behaviors from those around them.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's impressionable nature made it learn new tricks quickly.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like an impressionable canvas, ready to absorb any idea presented to him.
meanings.sent5: The young artist's impressionable style was heavily influenced by the works of famous painters.

meanings.definition: Capable of being easily molded or shaped.
meanings.sent1: The clay was impressionable and could be formed into any shape.
meanings.sent2: The young minds of students are impressionable and can be guided towards positive behaviors.
meanings.sent3: The impressionable dough eagerly took on the form of the cookie cutter.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was impressionable, open to new experiences and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The soft wax was impressionable under the sculptor's skilled hands.

meanings.definition: Susceptible to being impressed or marked.
meanings.sent1: The leather was impressionable, showing every scratch and crease.
meanings.sent2: The paper was impressionable, easily taking on the ink from the pen.
meanings.sent3: The impressionable snow captured the footprints of all who walked on it.
meanings.sent4: Her skin was impressionable, turning red at the lightest touch.
meanings.sent5: The sand was impressionable, holding the shape of the foot that stepped on it.
